Job Title: Field Investigation Engineer (Remote option)

Location: Wyoming, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation. We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment. Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.

Must reside within 90 minutes of a major airport.

Position Overview

Are you a seasoned Engineering professional with a knack for meticulous investigation and a passion for improving product safety? Polaris is seeking a Field Investigation Engineer to perform critical on-site investigations across various incidents involving our products. This role integrates engineering acumen and legal insights to conduct comprehensive investigations—ranging from fires and crashes to mechanical and electrical issues. Your findings will provide essential root cause analysis, shaping product enhancements and fortifying our commitment to safety. If you're looking for a dynamic career that tests your investigative skills, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Key Responsibilities

Conduct thorough on-site forensic investigations of incidents involving Polaris products worldwide, focusing on fires, crashes, and mechanical or electrical failures.Collect comprehensive data sets, including vehicle conditions, environmental scene, and narrative accounts, leveraging insights from subject matter experts (SMEs) to augment investigation quality.Analyze collected data and present findings in a Peer Review format to a multidisciplinary team of Polaris experts, contributing to broader safety initiatives.Act as the go-to Polaris technical expert for engineering analyses and product liability issues, guiding legal strategies and technical solutions.Provide clear and compelling testimony, including depositions and trial appearances, to support legal proceedings related to product incidents.Develop and share lessons learned with product teams, enhancing safety features and design considerations through cross-functional collaboration.

Desired Competencies

Analytical Proficiency: You have the proven ability to dissect complex problems, identify root causes, and devise effective solutions. Your methodical data analysis approach helps make informed decisions that enhance product safety and functionality.Communication Skills: You excel in articulating technical details and investigation outcomes across diverse groups, ensuring clarity and fostering collaborative improvement efforts within technical and non-technical teams.Adaptability and Flexibility: You thrive in environments that require frequent travel and rapid response. Your ability to adapt to new challenges on short notice and work independently is crucial in meeting the demands of this role.

Requirements

Must reside within 90 minutes of a major airport.AA or BS degree4+ years of relevant experience in product investigations.Exceptional communication skills and the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical groups.Able to travel up to 75% of the time, occasionally on short notice.Proficiency in Microsoft Suite

Preferences

Engineering DegreeCFI, CFEI, and ACTAR certifications.Experience in accident reconstruction, vehicle and structure fire investigations, and providing expert testimony.Familiarity with vehicle systems such as powertrain, chassis, electrical systems, and crashworthiness.Unmanned drone operation experience, CAD, 3D imaging, and familiarity with International Safety Standards and Testing Practices.

#Remote #Hybrid

We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE. Apply today!

At Polaris we put our employees first, by offering a holistic approach to their health and financial wellbeing. Polaris is proud to offer competitive compensation, including a market-leading profit-sharing plan that is fundamental to our pay-for-performance culture. At Polaris, employees are owners of the company through company contributions to our Employee Stock Ownership Plan and discounted employee stock purchases plan. Employees receive a generous matching contribution to 401(k), financial wellness education and consultation to plan for their financial future. In addition to competitive pay, Polaris provides a comprehensive suite of benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance, wellness programs, paid time off, gym & personal training reimbursement, life insurance and disability offerings. Through the Polaris Foundation and our Polaris Gives paid volunteer time off, we support employees who actively volunteer their time, efforts, and passions to improve the health and wellbeing of the communities in which they live, play and work. Employees at Polaris drive our success and are rewarded for their commitment.

About Polaris

As the global leader in powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. Polaris' high-quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER®, RZR® and Polaris GENERAL™ side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman® all-terrain off-road vehicles; military and commercial off-road vehicles; snowmobiles; Indian Motorcycle® mid-size and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot® moto-roadsters; Aixam quadricycles; Goupil electric vehicles; and pontoon and deck boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with a robust portfolio of parts, garments, and accessories. Proudly headquartered in Minnesota, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe. www.polaris.com
